page.title: 04 LANGUAGE LOCAL DIALECT
page.content: England is a country of many different accents and dialects.Within each county there are many variations of the English language. Penwortham people have a dialect and accent of their very own.Today, however, Penwortham dialect is dying out, but is still frequently used by the older generation.Below are a few well known phrases typical of the Penwortham area. aye-yes. nay-no. me-my. put wood in thole-shut the door. tha meks a better door than a winder- please move out of my view. there's trouble in the mill-trouble! thas getten feet like bairges-you've got big feet. I've got belly wairch-I've got stomach ache we had a reet gud do-we had a good time. ast a bin?-have you been?
